item.title: TMC - Defects - Other FW6 Surface problem, 7th January

item.title: Bin removed & now rubbish & dog bags left on green, 7th January
item.description:
This bin has only just been removed and yet on the first day there is already rubbish and dog bags left all over the green. Why has this been been removed? I would also like to know how I can get more involved with my local area and what meetings I can attend to voice my opinion because to be honest, I am getting sick of the mess around Glynbridge Gardens and the surrounding area and it is not fair The area is not being maintained. The greens are not being maintained. There are wet leaves everywhere on pathways causing hazardous situation for myself with a spinal injury already.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 163, Carter Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked culvert, 7th January
item.description:
///roost.seatbelt.pill 51°58'20.0172"N, 2°0'35.2152"W There is a culvert at this location. It is very overgrown but you can see the outlet on the North side of the road but not on the Southside

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Prescott, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin removed & left dangerous, 7th January
item.description:
The bin has been removed, but the base where it connects to has been left sticking out of the ground it had a little bit of dry grass over it so it was not clear to see. I have tripped on it. I already have a spinal injury and I’m using a stick for balance and support and now that has jolted my back and really hurt it. Why have you removed this bin? And secondly why have you left it so dangerous?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 163, Carter Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
